title: American Airlines' largest regional carrier gets FAA warning
description: A commuter jet was seconds away from landing at a regional airport in Illinois last March when the pilots realized they'd made a potentially fatal mistake: They were aimed at the wrong runway.

title: Billy Porter reveals he's been living with HIV for years
description: Billy Porter made history by winning an Emmy in 2019 for his role as Pray Tell, a character who is HIV-positive, on the FX series "Pose."

title: Study: Alcohol causes brain damage in any amount
description: There is no such thing as a "safe" level of drinking, with increased consumption of alcohol associated with poorer brain health, according to a new study.

title: 11-year-old girl fights off knife-wielding man in kidnapping attempt
description: An 11-year-old girl waiting for her school bus in Pensacola, Florida, was able to fight off an alleged kidnapping attempt on Tuesday morning and get to safety, authorities said.

title: Man invents a new surgery and cures himself
description: Doug Lindsay was bedridden for 11 years with a rare condition that didn't have a surgical fix - until he decided to invent the surgery himself.

title: What the cast of 'Friends' think their characters would be up today
description: The "Friends" reunion made the cast imagine who their characters would be today.

title: Republicans fear January 6 probe could undercut 2022 midterm message
description: Senior Republicans are making clear they have little interest in moving forward with a sweeping January 6 investigation in part because a detailed probe could become politically damaging and amount to a distraction for their party just as control of Congress is at stake in next year's midterm elections.

title: 'Girls5eva' and 5 recommendations to revisit Y2K
description: Record labels of the late 1990s and 2000s curated a seemingly endless march of girl groups in matchy-matchy outfits, all vying to be the next Spice Girls or Destiny's Child. But after a fall from the top 10 of "TRL" or the afterglow of "Making the Band" fame, what happened to these ephemeral pop stars?

title: Bill faces uncertain fate in Senate as GOP resistance grows
Analysis: Did McConnell just kill the January 6 commission?
description: Hours before the House was set to vote on legislation that would establish a bipartisan commission to investigate the January 6 insurrection at the US Capitol, Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell may have put the kibosh on the whole endeavor.

title: Bitcoin plunges to $40,000 as China widens its crypto crackdown
description: Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies are plunging as anxiety spreads through the market — this time, after China took more steps to crack down on the digital coins.

title: Explorer shares how his dyslexia helped him locate the Titanic
description: Robert Ballard tells CNN's Bianna Golodryga how he believes his dyslexia helped him locate the Titanic and why he views it as a gift.

title: China releases the first images taken by its Mars rover
description: China has released the first images taken by its Mars rover, Zhurong.

title: City dims skyline after 'mass collision' killed thousands of migrating birds
description: Nearly twenty buildings in Philadelphia are dimming their lights this spring after thousands of birds perished in the city's largest mass collision in recent history.

title: Obama just said something very interesting about UFOs
description: Barack Obama: He's just like us!

title: Biden singles out competition with Russia and China in speech
description: President Joe Biden singled out competition with Russia and China as part of his vision for the military branch's role in national security as he addressed the United States Coast Guard Academy's 2021 graduating class on Wednesday.

title: World's largest iceberg breaks off from Antarctica
description: The world's largest iceberg has calved from Antarctica over the past few days, a giant floating piece of ice close to 80 times the size of Manhattan.

title: 'I can't deal with this anymore': Video of 10-year-old in Gaza goes viral
description: As the violence of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict escalates for a second week, CNN's Arwa Damon hears from 10-year-old Gaza resident Nadine Abdullatief about how her life is being affected.

title: This is what it looks like when a star is born
description: Our lives happen in the blink of an eye compared to the course of a star's lifetime. Now, a team of scientists have developed a realistic and colorfully stunning simulation of what just the beginning of a star's life looks like.

title: 'Zombie fires' could become more common as global temperatures rise
description: As global temperatures rise, the once reliably frozen Arctic has seen a rash of massive wildfires in recent years.

title: Obama talks to Corden about aliens: There are some things I just can't tell you
description: Former President Barack Obama was asked his thoughts on UFOs during an appearance on "The Late Late Show with James Corden."

title: Zoo says baby polar bear's parents are brother and sister
description: Genetic testing has revealed that a baby polar bear at Tierpark Berlin zoo is the product of breeding between siblings.

title: Oatly could be worth $10 billion after New York IPO
description: Fast-growing Swedish oat milk brand Oatly is headed for a splashy New York IPO that will test investor demand for companies that make plant-based foods.

title: Texas 'heartbeat' abortion ban signed into law
description: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott on Wednesday signed into law a so-called "heartbeat ban" abortion bill -- barring most abortions at the onset of a fetal heartbeat, which can occur as early as six weeks into pregnancy and before many people know they are pregnant.

title: Truly taps Dua Lipa's star power as spiked seltzer wars escalate
description: Hard seltzer sales are surging but competition continues to grow, so Truly Hard Seltzer is using some star power to help the brand break through.

title: Hear Andrew Giuliani's bid to run for NY governor
description: Republican Andrew Giuliani, son of former New York Mayor Rudy Giuliani, announced he will be running for New York governor in 2022 while sounding off on current NY governor Andrew Cuomo. CNN's Brianna Keilar rolls the tape.

title: People flee in panic as skyscraper wobbles in China
description: Thousands of shoppers in the southern Chinese city of Shenzhen fled the vicinity of a 957-foot (291-meter) skyscraper Tuesday, after it inexplicably began swaying.

title: Avlon: Kevin McCarthy is afraid of Donald Trump
description: CNN's John Avlon looks into why House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy would be against a bipartisan commission looking into the insurrection on January 6, 2021.

title: Offices are reopening. For parents, that raises a childcare problem
description: The great reopening and return to pre-pandemic life is a tale of two timelines — and parents are caught in the middle.

title: How this micro airline has made it to its 75th anniversary
description: Think of Seattle, and what springs to mind? The Space Needle, for sure. Pike Place Market, almost certainly. For many, there's another classic sight in the Emerald City: the tiny seaplanes darting up and down, making a runway out of the water that surrounds the city.

title: Roger Federer and Serena Williams suffer shock defeats to dent French Open preparations
description: Roger Federer and Serena Williams may be able to boast 43 grand slam singles titles between them but both were left stunned by defeats within hours of each other on Tuesday.

title: Wolf cuts are this year's biggest haircut trend. And they might be familiar
description: If you see a teenager with a disheveled mullet that moves like a windblown shag, it's probably a hairstyle known as the "wolf cut." This 'do is recognizable by its voluminous crown, which swiftly tapers into wispy layers, and it is the latest Gen Z beauty trend to take social media by storm. Popular across genders, the wolf cut is thought to have originated in the salons of South Korea, taking its name from the wild, untamed look the heavy layers create, resembling the fur of its namesake. To take things further, the style is often set in place on loosely permed hair, to ensure an expertly tousled look.

title: Surreal images showcase an unseen South Africa
description: South African photographer Kristin-Lee Moolman has gained international recognition for her powerful portraits against surreal, bleached-out landscapes.

title: Town abandoned plans to host Olympic athletes. Here's why
description: The chorus of criticism surrounding the Olympics continues to grow. Dozens of Japanese towns have canceled plans to host foreign athletes from around the world due to concern over Covid-19. CNN's Blake Essig speaks to residents in small coastal town of Yokoshibahikari on the decision to pull out.

title: Former US Navy pilot on why she's speaking out about UFO sighting
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper talks to retired Navy Lt. Commander Alex Dietrich, a veteran combat pilot, about her report of spotting a UFO off the coast of San Diego in 2004.

title: Democratic House chair calls McCarthy 'weak and cowardly'
description: House Rules Chairman Jim McGovern (D-MA) ripped Republican leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) as "weak and cowardly" for opposing an inquiry to investigate the January 6 attack on the Capitol.

title: Why a North Carolina district attorney is not prosecuting the Andrew Brown Jr. killing
description: On Tuesday morning, District Attorney Andrew Womble said the fatal shooting of Andrew Brown Jr. by Pasquotank County sheriff's deputies was justified. He held a press conference explaining his decision, outlining his understanding of the law, and he played four video clips from the body-worn cameras of officers at the scene.

title: Arizona auditors now say voter data is intact, after sparking GOP feud
description: Auditors hired by the Arizona state Senate backtracked Tuesday from claims that a key database had been deleted from Maricopa County's elections servers -- admitting in a hearing held by the Senate Republicans overseeing the audit that the data is intact and they'd been looking the wrong way.

title: About 60% of American adults have had at least one dose of Covid-19 vaccine, including more people of color
description: The US has reached a "landmark day" in the Covid-19 pandemic as 60% of American adults have gotten at least one dose of a coronavirus vaccine, the director of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said.

title: Resistance to January 6 commission grows among Senate Republicans
description: The fate of an independent commission to investigate the deadly January 6 attack on the US Capitol will soon rest in the hands of Senate Republicans, many of whom are already signaling they may block the bill from moving forward with arguments that a commission isn't necessary.
